abstract: Exxon Mobil has agreed to pay about $4 billion for a minority stake in a oil field off the coast of Ghana, a region that has emerged as a major new petroleum province, a person with knowledge of the matter said Tuesday.
snippet: Exxon Mobil has agreed to pay about $4 billion for a minority stake in a oil field off the coast of Ghana, a region that has emerged as a major new petroleum province, a person with knowledge of the matter said Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: The energy giant Exxon Mobil has agreed to pay about $4 billion for a minority stake in a oil field off the coast of Ghana, a region that has emerged as a major new petroleum province, a person with knowledge of the matter said Tuesday, The New York Times’s Jad Mouawad and Zachery Kouwe report.

headline.main: Exxon Said to Pay $4 Billion for Oil Field
